newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft realigns into two product areas.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft realigns into two product areas.

text.p: Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday it had reorganized the company into two product groups -- one for interactive media and one for platforms and applications.
Group vice president Pete Higgins will head the interactive media area while group vice president Paul Maritz will be in charge of platforms and applications.
The company also said Patty Stonesifer, senior vice president of the interactive media division, had resigned to pursue "personal interests" and a new career as a management consultant.
Microsoft also said group vice president Nathan Myhrvold would assume the new position of chief technology officer in charge of the company's advanced technology and research group.

In announcing the company's fourth reorganization in less than three years, Microsoft Chairman Bill Gates said the software giant was aiming to intensify its focus on the Internet and related technology.

"Today's realignment optimizes Microsoft's ability to take advantage of the business and technical opportunities we see as customers rapidly adopt the Internet and intranets into their daily lives," Gates said in a statement.
Stonesifer, credited with building Microsoft's consumer software business, will stay with the company through the end of the year.
As a consultant, her first client will be Hollywood studio DreamWorks SKG.
